natural problem: Find the greatest common divisor of $40304$ and $30203$.
natural solution: &= \text{gcd}(10101 - 10001, 10001) \\ &= \text{gcd}(100, 10001) \\ &= \text{gcd}(10001 - 100\cdot100, 100) \\ &= \text{gcd}(1, 100) \\ \end{align}Therefore, the greatest common divisor of $40304$ and $30203$ is $\boxed{1}$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: nat
assumes h0 : "a = 40304"
and h1 : "b = 30203"
shows  "gcd a b = 1"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the greatest common divisor of $40304$ and $30203$. The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 By the Euclidean Algorithm: \begin{align} \text{gcd}(40304, 30203) &= \text{gcd}(40304-30203, 30203) \\ &= \text{gcd}(10101, 30203) \\ &= \text{gcd}(30203-2\cdot10101, 10101) \\ &= \text{gcd}(10001, 10101) \\
 &= \text{gcd}(10101 - 10001, 10001) \\ &= \text{gcd}(100, 10001) \\ &= \text{gcd}(10001 - 100\cdot100, 100) \\ &= \text{gcd}(1, 100) \\ \end{align}Therefore, the greatest common divisor of $40304$ and $30203$ is $\boxed{1}$
 *)

assumes h0 : "a = 40304"
and h1 : "b = 30203"

 proof-
